com.poesys.db.dao

Class AbstractBatch<T extends IDbDto>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.dao.AbstractBatch<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of IDbDto to process
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeleteBatchByKey, InsertBatch, UpdateBatchByKey

    public abstract class AbstractBatch<T extends IDbDto>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract superclass for batch-oriented data access object (DAO) classes that provides helper methods for processing results and errors encountered during JDBC batch processing of a specified kind of data transfer object (DTO).
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller
    See Also:
    IDbDto

    • Method Detail

      • processErrors

        protected boolean processErrors(int[] codes,
                    java.util.List<T> dtos,
                    java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
                         throws InvalidParametersException
        Process the error codes from a JDBC batch. Extract the DTO corresponding to any error from the list of DTOs in the batch and construct an error message containing the primary key values of the object that failed to insert. Note that all DTOs not in FAILED status have been successfully processed, so there is no need to set the processed flag to off. The method that sets the error message also marks the DTO as unprocessed.
        Parameters:
        codes - the codes for the DTOs starting at the index; can be null
        dtos - the list of DTOs in the batch
        builder - a StringBuilder with any previous set of messages
        Returns:
        true if there were errors, false if there were none
        Throws:
        InvalidParametersException - when the sizes of the error code array and the list of DTOs does not match

      • appendErrorString

        private boolean appendErrorString(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                        IDbDto dto)
        Append the error information for a DTO to an input Builder and set the dto to Failed status and unprocessed.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder to which to append
        dto - the DTO to represent as a string
        Returns:
        true if there is an error, false if not

      • setProcessed

        protected void setProcessed(java.util.List<T> list,
                java.lang.Boolean processed)
        Set all the DTOs in a list as processed.
        Parameters:
        list - a list of unprocessed DTOs
        processed - the value to which to set the flag (true, false)
